ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I feel the topics were isolated and didn't have a way to connect them smoothly.
Best class so far at FES
One of the most important courses offered at FES. Should be offered every year.
That it combined theoretical learning and practical work for a client, it was a very valuable experience.
Because of the small size of the class we were able to have very interesting discussion. Moreover, we had to chance to work with a company for the final paper.
The work with an outside stakeholder to develop a project.
Refresher of NPP and Carbon basics, up'to'date info about policy and markets, and the consulting project
Everything you wanted to know about carbon and how it relates to climate change. pete and rob are a great combo

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: A good idea for improvement would be to have some mathematical exercises on carbon cycle together with the weekly commentaries for better understanding of the readings.
it seems after midterms, we only had one or two lectures, with class time dedicated for the project. i would have like to see more lectures towards the end because i always learned a lot from them

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both instructors were very helpful, available, quick to respond and made sure we got all the help we needed. The TA was the best TA I have ever had in a class here, she made sure everything was running smoothly and went above and beyond the norm when she responded to students' commentaries with extra care and attention to detail.
The TA and the instructors were more than helpful and always available to answer questions.

pete and rob are available, but very busy. jasmine should win best TA of the year...she would give half page responses to our one page summaries and ask some very interesting questions as part of her feedback. we got some great comments from pete on our final paper

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: very interested in carbon and its role in climate change, and we were able to pursue a final project in REDD which I'm quite interested in

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To fulfill a requirement and gain practical experience working on a real problem for a client.
it's what i came to FES to learn about

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
yes
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
yes
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Working on the projects in teams made it a much more valuable experience for all the students, I learned and accomplished a lot more than I would be able to if I worked on my own.

The collaboration among the members of the group was perfect,all the meetings ran smoothly and were thought-provocing, and the final paper was delivered on time and was of great quality. I did not find any disadvantages in the group work.
We could learn a lot in the process of doing an applied analysis
advantages: different people bring different strenghts, although it requires solid communication to make the most of itdisadvantages:different writing styles make group work very challenging
Great group project that may help me get a job.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Definitely take this class as a capstone or if you just want a practicum, it is definitely worth the effort.
take the course and do all the readings
